title: Hope Springs Eternal for Lyft and Uber Investors
text:
Rough public waters seem to have ride-hailers and their investors reaching for virtually any kind of flotation device—even one riddled with holes.

Last Tuesday, shares of Lyft and Uber spiked to intraday highs up 11% and 8%, respectively, after Lyft’s co-founders said at a Wall Street Journal tech conference that their business would make money on the basis of adjusted earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortization in the fourth quarter of 2021. That pledge may successfully buoy ride-hailers’ stocks in the near-term....
